Reviews.Content: Plenty of historical atmosphere Was a bit tricky to find as florence is all tall buildings  narrow streets, once there superb location. Room was spacious, simple  clean and the whole building oozed historical atmosphere, could see that stairs may be a problem for some people, but personally found ok. Breakfast not the best, but adequate. Only problem we had was with a faulty key card, so check before you go out at night. Was a good budget option in a very expensive but beautiful city, would definately go back but book a room with private bathroom facilities next time.
Reviews.Author: travelcatDorset

Reviews.Content: 1500's Palace!!       Florence Duomo
Reviews.Author: robinelisse

Reviews.Content: Basic but great location Hotel Bavaria was pretty much what we expected for the price we paid, and the fact it advertised itself as one star. The room was very basic, just a bed, sink and shower, but clean. Toilets down the hall, which were also clean. Breakfast wasn't great but did the job. Stories about mosquitos are true, we were there in July and had to leave the windows open because it was so hot, but paid the price in mosquito bites! The location is fantasic, the Duomo is only a few minutes away, as are most of Florence's attractions. We found it very hard to actually locate the hotel, we walked up and down the street for at least half and hour before we found it. All the buildings have 2 different street numbers which is very confusing, and the sign for the hotel is on the wall of the building and very small! Follow the advice of one of the other reviewers - look for the bridal shop (there's only one in the street) and the hotel is directly opposite. Stories about the stairs are true - if you are not prepared to carry your luggage up lots and lots of stairs, don't book this place. If you want a great location and a clean bed to sleep in at night but don't want to spend much money, hotel bavaria is a great choice.
Reviews.Author: Anna115

Reviews.Content: a little primitive       courtyard view from room
Reviews.Author: asford1

Reviews.Content: Great Location Best price thru Venere. Came by car and got lost looking for it. Finally found a great garage to park at that was only 1 block away. Still had trouble finding it while standing right in front of it. It was a Sunday and the doors were closed. The street names don't always match the plaques on the buildings - on one side its Via del Corso, and on the other, it's Abruzzi. If it's helpful, the door is directly across from a wedding dress store, and if the door is closed you have to get buzzed up. Once inside, you have to climb a few flights of stairs, no elevator. Owners very nice and helpful. Our room was very large, perfect for us and two teenagers. We had a bathroom in our room which was old but fine. Lighting was not so great. No TV, but who needs it on a great vacation. We played cards and laughed a lot. Beautiful courtyard. There was an early evening thunderstorm which was fun to watch. Continental breakfast was good. Very short walk to Duomo. Fantastic! This is a very quaint, clean, quiet, and friendly place to stay.
Reviews.Author: aviatorlady

Reviews.Content: Close to Duomo We stayed for 3 nights and were disappointed not to have an ensuite room. The bathroom that we shared was used by several people (from 5 or 6 rooms!) .....some using the shower facility and some the toilet, as they had partial en suites in their rooms. There was also a lovely open, common area where people could congregate with fellow residents.Our bedroom, which had a sink, was fairly basic (no TV, or phone) and we made the mistake of leaving the window open as we slept. The next day we found that we were badly bitten by mosquitoes, which left us with welts on our skin, that have lasted over 2 weeks.Breakfast was fairly good and the staff seemed helpful.To get to our room it was about 83 concrete steps (yes, we counted them!) from the main floor, so this hotel is not for the faint hearted or frail, especially if you have to carry your own luggage. The location was good for us, close to the Duomo and the main train station.
Reviews.Author: ABCanuck

Reviews.Content: Great location, but... We spent three nights in hotel Bavaria. The location is great. It is close to everything. The hotel staff are friendly. The breakfast is OK.But think again if you want to stay in this hotel. Don't put much expectation on it. It's just basic. The picture shown online looks much nicer than it actually is. You should be warned those rooms facing the street could be very noisy during night. I almost couldn't sleep for the first night. No bedbugs but mosquitos! I saw a mosquito, but didn't pay much attention to it. The next morning I found more than 5 spots on my hands and arms. Then I searched for mosquitos and killed five with fresh blood. Also, no safes provided. So if you bring valuables, you'd better take more care.I think I would find another place to stay if I visit Firenze again.
Reviews.Author: Travelania

Reviews.Content: Great Location! Stayed here in October '07 with two friends. The location was the primary reason for our choice of this hotel as it's close to everything that Florence has to offer. Our room was a triple with shower in the room and was nice- HUGE room with beautiful fresco on the wall. The only thing we didn't like about the room was the fact that the hotel doesn't offer a full water closet in the room, so we still had to go down the hall to use the toilet...but we knew that when we booked. Other than that, the room was quiet and our window faced a central courtyard, so it was pretty peaceful. We felt safe- to get in to the hotel, there's the locked door into the courtyard, another locked door into the establishment, and then the door to your room. This hotel is definitely bare bones, but the staff was nice and accomodating, the facilities clean, and the location unbeatable! I would stay here again just due to the convenience/ease of the location for exploring Florence.
Reviews.Author: Imraezin

Reviews.Content: Bare bones but decent Hotel Bavaria's strong points are that it is well-located, in a charming old building, and has great staff. Its weak points are that the walls are thin and rooms are quite noisy - we stayed when it was half-empty, but the guys next to us kept us awake. Rooms vary quite a bit - we stayed in #7, nice (no fresco on the wall, but charmingly decorated) and #5 (double bed - too small for the two of us). It's a hostel or one-star hotel, so what you get will be pretty basic - towels are large but thin; breakfast is basic but decent (1 or 2 rolls, jam, cereal, processed cheese, lousy coffee). Beds were oddly comfortable, or maybe I was so exhausted that I could sleep through anything. The water from the faucets inexplicably smells of bleach - it didn't anywhere else in Florence. There are two bathrooms; use the tiny shower in the back (good water pressure) and not the larger shower next to the breakfast room (unless you like a gentle trickle for your shower). The hotel is up two long flights of stairs - but by the end of your stay in Florence, it'll feel like nothing. There's an office in the building that receives a lot of deliveries by scooter in the morning, so around 8 you'll hear a lot of scooter traffic echoing through the building (but you'll probably be up anyways). The staff is extremely helpful - booked reservations, recommended great restaurants, and were generally very nice. They have a book exchange. The street it's located on is a nice pedestrian-friendly street, and it's within ten minutes to everything in Florence. We were a little punchy after our long flight and had a hard time finding the place, even with their directions. The street names don't always match the plaques on the buildings - on one side its Via del Corso, and on the other, it's Abruzzi. If it's helpful, the door is directly across from a wedding dress store, and if the door is closed you have to get buzzed up. This was one of the cheaper places we found in Florence, and was decent - but if I had the extra cash I might spring for something a little less basic.
Reviews.Author: sr70

Reviews.Content: Great location I recommend Hotel Bavaria to anyone with low expectations of accommodations and high hopes for location. For the money, you can't beat its location. It's probably a three-minute walk from the Duomo. Surprisingly, too, it's quiet. That said, I do have my gripes about the room. It's small and basic: no TV, no AC, no private bath, no frills. The breakfast is decent, though. Definitely a place to consider if you're in Florence for a couple of days on a budget!
Reviews.Author: Bill12345

Reviews.Content: Wish we were there now! My husband and I adored the staff at this hotel, and thought that the atmosphere overall was wonderful. The breakfast was nice and the rooms with the original frescoes still on the wall made it all very special. The location can't be beat and the simple furnishings were just fine with us. The owner and her staff were incredibly helpful with a lost luggage fiasco, and went above and beyond the call of duty. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: viajeratejana

Reviews.Content: Nice location but watch out for mosquito attack Hotel Bavaria is located in the very convenient area and in walking distance for many of main tourist attractions. Duomo is only a few minutes on foot. We liked the location of this hotel a lot. The hotel is very old but it was fun to stay because we felt like staying at a medieval building.The hotel is located on the 3rd floor in the building and our room was on the 4th floor and there was no elevator. I really don鈥檛 know how you call 鈥渇loors鈥?in Italy because some of the stairs long and some are not. Anyway, it was a very good exercise to reach our room. To be honest, it was a challenge to climb up with our heavy laggauges when we first checked in. The staff seemed a nice guy and first he offered me to carry my laggauge from the 3rd floor to the 4th (or you may call it from 3rd to the 3rd and half). When he found out my carry-on was heavy he quickly pretended that he had a backache and dropped it. It was very obvious and our family was able to tell that he was faking. We thought he was very weird. We stayed a room with 3 beds and a bathroom. Beds are very old and sink when we get on them. Our kids were joking about the beds saying, 鈥淭hese are like hammocks.鈥?As some of the viewers mentioned, a shower doesn鈥檛 have a shower curtain or any kind of divider from a toilet so when we shower the whole bathroom gets very wet and has water puddles. You need to be very careful after shower so you don鈥檛 slip and fall. By the next morning it always gets dry though.Our major complain was mosquitoes. Since there is no air condition in the room they opened the windows before our arrival. There are no screens in the windows. We thought we would have no problem with mosquitoes since we were on the 4th floor. We were wrong. We had major mosquito attack on our first night. We had decided to choose between the hot room and mosquito attack. I understand that Hotel Bavaria is not a luxurious hotel so we can compromise some of the aspects of the Hotel. In my opinion, I highly recommend this hotel when you stay there in cool months when you don鈥檛 need to open the windows and you don鈥檛 need to worry about mosquitoes. Don鈥檛 choose this hotel if you have difficulty to walk or climb or if you have back problem.
Reviews.Author: Pocono

Reviews.Content: Decent and affordable This was a decent hotel with an old feel to it. The room was large but the floor squeaked a lot. We had our own bathroom which we all shared. Four friends shared one room with two large beds. It was on the third or fourth floor and about 1-2 blocks from the Duomo. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I think the pictures that are posted make it seem a lot nicer then it actually is.
Reviews.Author: GabalishCA

Reviews.Content: Great one-star 'pensione' in a perfect location If you bear in mind that this is a one star hotel, it鈥檚 hard to assess it as less than perfect. I had a shared bathroom and a very simple room, but that鈥檚 what one would expect in this price category. The building is a classic Florentine apartment building, which now has a mix of apartments and businesses. It has a pleasant courtyard, a sweeping staircase (note that Hotel Bavaria is on the third floor off the ground and there鈥檚 no lift, so it鈥檇 be difficult for people with strollers, wheelchairs or large amounts of heavy luggage), and inside it is furnished in traditional Florentine style: simple, comfortable and classic.The location is superb: right in the middle of the 鈥楥entro Storico鈥?(the historical centre) about a block away from the famous Duomo (Cathedral) and within a mile or so鈥檚 walk to just about any important sight, museum and monument in Florence. Here鈥檚 a summary of my other impressions over the four nights I stayed here:THE GOOD* perfect location* very clean* quiet at night (yes, you can hear some street noise, but this is Florence and having previously lived in the city for a couple of years I felt the level of noise here was very low for the city centre)* friendly, helpful staff* good value for money (it鈥檚 not great value, but Florence has a reputation as a very expensive city and it鈥檚 OK in comparison with other places)* I have memories of vicious, clever Florentine mosquitoes who enjoyed tormenting me when I lived in the city, so one of my first questions was about whether they were bad at present. I was immediately given an electronic mozzie zapper to plug in at night, and didn鈥檛 suffer any bites during my stay.* breakfast was included. It was very simple, but OK for a one star hotel, and the breakfast room was pleasant enough.* on the ground floor of the hotel there were two shared bathrooms for rooms without their own. These were kept quite clean during my stay (I鈥檓 fussy about cleanliness/hygiene and found nothing to complain about here).* reasonable security * good sized room (especially considering mine was a single room without bathroom) with a hand basin.* comfortable bed with wonderful, fresh, crisp, quality linen. THE DOWNSIDES:* it could do with a fresh coat of paint.* there鈥檚 no phone in the room (though it is just a one star hotel, so you wouldn鈥檛 expect one) BUT they were happy to take messages.* there鈥檚 no TV in the room (though, again, one wouldn鈥檛 expect one in a one star hotel) but there鈥檚 one in the breakfast room if you鈥檙e desperate for your telly-fix.SUMMARY:Recommended! It鈥檇 be hard to find better in Florence in this price range.
Reviews.Author: UKAussie-Abroad

Reviews.Content: all good....recommended! Fantastic value! Stayed here 4 nights in (huge) triple room which worked out very good indeed price wise, even though we had to forgo what was a proper bathroom (still had a shower and sink so no big deal). Real period character as well - all french doors and tiled floors. Couldn't fault location either - just a minute or so from the Duomo and opening straight out into the bustle of the city itself with all the restaurants and bars nearby. Staff seemed friendly also - although we weren't too demanding!Negative points? Some may find the stairs a bit of a challenge admittedly, and the breakfast area looked pretty gloomy (but as we discovered, why bother when such great cafes are around?.). Others may baulk at the communal bathroom but it was generally in reasonably good order - most of the time. Basically, if you are looking for high luxury, forget it! This place is all about it's original patina and not mod cons or surgical cleanliness. After all, hotels are only for sleeping in really. Enjoy!
Reviews.Author: mynchiboy

Reviews.Content: Good value, higly recommendable We were two ladies who stayed 3 nights in this place. We enjoyed the location. Beautyful huge room (with bath), breakfast included OK. Many steps but also OK. Helpful staff. Exellent location, walking distance to museums etc.
Reviews.Author: AnneHN

Reviews.Content: No bedbugs, great location I stayed at the Bavaria from Sept 18-21st with one of my girlfriends. We didn't have any issue at all with bedbugs or mosquitos. The hotel, yes, is on the 4th floor, but that didn't really bother us. The management held our passports during our stay, which surprised me but then I figured it was probably safer with them than me carrying it around. You really can't beat the location of this hotel - the duomo is a few blocks away and there are cute shops (including LUSH!) and cafes on the street. I would say Bavaria is a bit more like a hostel in which you have your own room. We never had a problem waiting for the shower down the hall, the towels were high quality, and the place was quiet and felt secure - with no curfew time. The breakfast was really good for a free breakfast - yogurt, cereals, bread and toast, jams and Nutella, coffee, juice, tea. The proprietor even helped us find and book a hotel for the next part of our trip in Siena and told us the best way to get to the bus station. I'd stay at Bavaria again - I'm sure the bedbug thing is not typical and will be taken care of quickly.
Reviews.Author: beegove

Reviews.Content: Dirty and Incompetent My partner and I spent one night in this hotel when we were in Florence and it was by far the worst of our trip. First, we had to lug our suitcases up four flights of stairs to even get to our room. We had specifically reserved one with a private bathroom, but the staff messed up our reservation and so we had to use the communal one, which was shared by five other rooms and filthy. The person showing us to our room didn't admit that they had made a mistake until we almost at the room, at which point it was just too much trouble to carry our suitcases back down the stairs. The room itself was grimy and unpleasant looking, and there were yellow stains on the sheets that looked distinctly like urine. The next morning we asked that they call us a cab to go to the airport, which they tried unsuccessfully to do (something about a marathon keeping all the taxis out of Florence that day, but we were able to get one just a ten minute walk away at the train station, although we had to lug all our bags through the streets). About all I can say that is positive with respect to this hotel is that its in a good location, and the public areas have a certain faded grandeur. Also, the rooms are cheap and a passable if uninteresting breakfast is included, so I guess its economical. When I traveled in college that might have been enough...but not anymore.
Reviews.Author: DanW329

Reviews.Content: Bed bugs? Maybe... We were there a few days earlier in September and while my friend did get bitten badly the first night we deducted it were mosquitos. Bought a 3 euro anti-mozzie spray which worked a charm. We had no problems for the remainder of our stay. For the price and location this is a great find in Florence. We had a massive and quiet room with own bathroom and view of the Duomo. Breakfast is ok for a BB although the coffee is tailored towards its american guests. I dashed out for a proper espresso strong coffee after breakfast. Only downside to staying on the 4th floor of a palazzo, you do have to walk quite a few flight of stairs, so pack lightly. And check out the ice cream parlour across the street, it has both cheap good ice cream and a cute italian boy working there ;)
Reviews.Author: synnae

Reviews.Content: Bedbugs! Yes, there were definitely bugs, and they were definitely from this hotel. My husband and I together sustained more than 300 bites, though he had most of them since he slept under the covers and I slept on top. We didn't ask to change rooms because at breakfast, we saw that all the other guests had bites on their arms, faces, etc. Amount of bites we sustained from just one night on the bed suggested that the infestation was large and well developed, and had been there for a while. Matress looked new and clean, but the large red itchy welts spoke for themselves. Cancellation policy was such that we would have had to pay for the four nights anyway, even if we went elsewhere, so we just slept on the tiled floor, on towels, the last three nights (ugh.) Yes the ceilings are high, and yes there are (fake) antiques in the rooms. Also, the location is unbelievably good, and you probably can't find a better spot from which to explore Florence. But are you willing to pay for it in blood?
Reviews.Author: justgottaseeit

Reviews.Content: Perfect location and price A beautiful 16th century building, that is seriously just a one minute walk from the duomo. We had a sweet room without bathroom, but with a sink, which is quite common in Italy. The staff were very helpful and let us use their fridge, and made bookings for us. We paid 60 euros, and they gave my friend a very good discount for staying in the same room by herself for a few days until I arrived. I have recommended this hotel to many friends and they agree with me that it can't be beaten on price, location, and sweetness. It gives you the proper Italian experience.
Reviews.Author: TravellingItalia

Reviews.Content: Unique Hotel A truly unique hotel in a 16th century building. You have to go up four stairs to reach it, but it's worth it. It is very close to the center, just two minutes to Piazza del Republica. We paid 50 euro for a double room. The staff is friendly and speaks English. Rooms are large and clean. This hotel is a very good deal for staying in Florence.
Reviews.Author: TravelReviewer-TA
